content:
Can someone else go to the playground with Firefox 80 and see if the output has lost all colors?

image.png

Vs Chrome:

image.png
working on FF 78
I'm using Firefox 80 (Windows). The reds and blues are in the output as normal.
Thanks. I'm on macOS, so I guess that's another variable. It could also be some plugin I have, but I'm not at a good spot to restart the browser :-)
Since web extensions disabling an extension should work fine without restarting firefox.
TIL! Looks like disabling them and reloading the page doesn't change my behavior — still no colors.
Working on Firefox 79 (macOS)
@Jake Goulding Just updated to Firefox 80 and now having the same issue
Well, that's good and bad :upside_down:
Guess I know what I'm looking into tonight
Can you try reloading the page with a fresh cache? On Windows this is ctrl-f5. I don't know the mac shortcut.
I tried it with another webpage and the text color is also not working (it's supposed to be white, but it's black)
I think it's Shift-Cmd-R on Mac. Same issue
Seems like a bug with Firefox
Well, that's good and bad :upside_down: :upside_down: :upside_down:
It works for me on Firefox Developer Edition 81.0b1 (Linux).
The only other thing I can think of is that it might be related to hardware acceleration. Or it could just be a mac specific bug.
Well, it seems like it might be a Firefox bug that's only on macOS

I meant hardware rendering can have quirks depending on the specific hardware and macs are pretty uniform hardware wise. The problem could of course be elsewhere, I mostly suggested it because it's easy to turn off.
@Jake Goulding Filing a report on Bugzilla
Oh, nice. I was not looking forward to wrangling with bugzilla

@Jake Goulding I have FF 80 on macOS, and the colors look fine to me. I also tried using an empty profile, and it also seemed fine. Do you happen to have the Source Code Pro font installed locally? There is a bug in FireFox that newer versions of that font don't support colors properly on macOS. More details at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1520157. I would try turning off the "Source Code Pro" css rule in the inspector and see if that helps.
Oh no
Oh no for me too
I had the same bug with another website but it uses Source Code Pro as well
Well, that's super exciting.
Yep, works without Source Code Pro
this title keeps getting more and more specific :laughing:
Considering that a _previous_ playground issue was solved by installing SCP locally.
Good thing I didn't file the bug yet!
Another instance: https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/fdj80k/caniusers_rust_feature_search/fji2nwf/ Sounds like other browsers don't have this problem.
poor rust world
I was about to comment on that Bugzilla bug but you beat me to it!
I guess I'll have to edit it to prefer the webfont instead

Yea, if you drop the local, it might help. I don't remember the details, but older versions of Source Code Pro don't have the colorized glyphs that cause the problems. You can also manually build the font in such a way to exclude them.
I'm pretty sure the google fonts copies should be ok.
Thanks for finding that bug @Eric Huss!
Interestingly, the Rust docs display correctly, and they use Source Code Pro: screenshot
Yea, in rustdoc, it is intentionally using an older version of Source Code Pro to avoid this problem.
Ah, didn't realize that
image.png
well, I wish there was something more than that
Maybe it just means "we shipped that version so it wont be fixed there"
Maybe it will be fixed in 81?

Jake Goulding said:

Maybe it just means "we shipped that version so it wont be fixed there"

That's what it means.

@Jake Goulding Maybe you could serve a bundled version like Rustdoc? I think this is the file: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/80cacd77954b39a6bc205213faa8c82c97eb0055/src/librustdoc/html/static/SourceCodePro-Regular.woff
The playground already effectively does, but from Google fonts instead of itself. The fix is to prefer that instead of a local font.
I'm not sure if there's a way to have Google Fonts prefer their version over the local font, although maybe you could copy the Google Fonts CSS file and manually edit it...
Ah never mind, it looks like you shouldn't copy the CSS file because it is browser-specific: https://css-tricks.com/dont-just-copy-the-font-face-out-of-google-fonts-urls/
@Jake Goulding Maybe it would make sense to just serve your own copy of the font rather than relying on Google Fonts? Then you can control which one is preferred

It's fixed for me on Firefox 83! :tada:

@Jake Goulding Does it work for you?
heh, i've been ignoring the 83 update... restarting now
restarted... into ff 82.whatever
restarting again
Hello red colors
I didn't realize how much it was driving me crazy until it was fixed :laughter_tears:
oh man, tell me about it
Two good things today already: Servo is back and Firefox is fixed!
And min_const_generics got its stabilization PR
